commit_message:
Fixes: bug #1111972

A few minor changes:
- Handle KeyError exception when there are no events found in the sample-list subcommand.
- Slight modification to the text output when no sample are found since the samples
  are not always based on counters.
- Fix a small type of the 'sample-list' subcommand help string: "this meters" changed to
  "the meters".

Change-Id: I6e95434b11031f2be91c185e24d579c19b3d5efe

subject: Fixes: bug #1111972
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 00:16:57.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/v1/shell.py', 'ceilometerclient/common/base.py'], 'message': 'Fixes: bug #1111972

Catch KeyError exception as early as possible in base.py. Return an empty list, causing
the python client to print nothing when no entries are returned by the server. An empty
list is required because the calling code expects an iterable.

Change-Id: I07008366bc7b1c912327af6f67d80dc35edf0524
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixes: bug #1111972

Catch KeyError exception as early as possible in base.py. Return an empty list, causing
the python client to print nothing when no entries are returned by the server. An empty
list is required because the calling code expects an iterable.

Change-Id: I07008366bc7b1c912327af6f67d80dc35edf0524

commit_message:
support reloctable venv roots in testing framework

run_tests.sh, with_venv.sh, and the install_venv.py scripts now
support relocating the venv root to another location.

All 3 scripts now support new envinroment variables to configure
the location of the venv and the tools directory. To maintain
compatability the defaults are set to the current values.

venv_path = Location of the virtualenv directory
	Default: $(pwd)

venv_name = Name of the virtualenv directory
	Default: .venv

tools_path = Location of the tools directory
	Default: $(pwd)

Additionally the run_tests.sh script also takes these value as
arguments and will pass them along accordingly.

--virtual-env-path <path>   Location of the virtualenv directory
                             Default: $(pwd)
--virtual-env-name <name>   Name of the virtualenv directory
                             Default: .venv
--tools-path <dir>          Location of the tools directory
                             Default: $(pwd)

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1be036058227206ecca342f692cd3d6aadb24069
Fixes: bug #1116942

subject: Ensure 'subunit2pyunit' is run in venv from run_tests.sh
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 16:02:16.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Ensure 'subunit2pyunit' is run in venv from run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script invokes

  bash -c "${wrapper} $TESTRTESTS | subunit2pyunit"

where '${wrapper}' expands to 'tools/with_venv.sh'. Due to shell
precedence rules, this only applies to '$TESTRTESTS' not the
'subunit2pyunit' part of the command. The 'subunit2pyunit' binary
though may only be available from the .venv

Change-Id: I5972c8f77b3f50a3713881e6ca1acbaeabbd47d4
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ensure 'subunit2pyunit' is run in venv from run_tests.sh

The run_tests.sh script invokes

  bash -c "${wrapper} $TESTRTESTS | subunit2pyunit"

where '${wrapper}' expands to 'tools/with_venv.sh'. Due to shell
precedence rules, this only applies to '$TESTRTESTS' not the
'subunit2pyunit' part of the command. The 'subunit2pyunit' binary
though may only be available from the .venv

Change-Id: I5972c8f77b3f50a3713881e6ca1acbaeabbd47d4
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
L3 API support for nicira plugin

blueprint nvp-l3-api

This patch adds supports the Quantum L3 API extension to the nicira NVP
Quantum Plugin.

The patch includes code for managing Quantum routers, router interfaces,
external gateways, and floating IPs, and for applying the relevant
configurations on the NVP controller using the NVP API.

The patch also includes NVP-specific support for access to the nova
metadata server via injection of a host route in VM instances.

Change-Id: I20b45190f1eaca0229d30871b25484b90298a18b

commit_message:
Mask permissions on private key files

When using "nova x509-create-cert", the private key should be written to
a file with the permissions 0400, not (world-readable) 0644, in line
with how ssh private keys are treated.

bug 1112605

Change-Id: I0b20378efba38fa58f4ad9a33cd15b3432ebb8a2
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add firewall_driver option to linuxbridge_conf.ini

Fixes bug 1121855

firewall_driver configuration option has been introduced in the patch
of OVS security group support and it affects Linux Bridge plugin.
The default value of firewall_driver is NoopDriver.
Thus firewall_driver configuration is required in Linux Bridge plugin.

Change-Id: I403be91b01eb6fa679dab28cd4995c85d12100b9

commit_message:
Update to requests >= 0.8

The requests module dropped all configuration with the 1.0.0 release.
There's no danger_mode and no 'verbose'' mode. The former
shouldn't be necessary anymore and the latter can be done by setting
a different log handler for the request.logging root logger.

Change-Id: Iec169ef6e39097814cdbf1b777bc0590236692ba

[{'created': '2013-02-04 22:41:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

Simplify the MySQL-only threaded DB pooling.  Use SQLAlchemy's standard
QueuePool, but source connections via a custom creator function.  The
creator proxies requests to get connections from MySQL through
eventlet's thread pool singleton. (tpool)

This is simpler than having both a SQLAlchemy and eventlet
TpooledConnectionPool where each connection pool had different
settings to keep in sync.

Also, pass the 'pool_size' and 'max_overflow' settings to SQLAlchemy.
They were previously missing.

commit_message:
Simplify MySQL/eventlet threaded db pooling.

Simplify the MySQL-only threaded DB pooling.  Use SQLAlchemy's standard
QueuePool, but source connections via a custom creator function.  The
creator proxies requests to get connections from MySQL through
eventlet's thread pool singleton. (tpool)

This is simpler than having both a SQLAlchemy and eventlet
TpooledConnectionPool where each connection pool had different
settings to keep in sync.

Also, pass the 'pool_size' and 'max_overflow' settings to SQLAlchemy.
They were previously missing.

Change-Id: Ia5094f50a60ab4507d545d86962aac51c2bb164d

commit_message:
heat engine : add option to control instance boto http/https

Currently the heat-jeos code defaults to http only, but we are
about to fix that, so we instead need a way to specify if
instances should connect via http or https - boto provides the
is_secure config file option, so add a new heat option which
controls this setting in the boto config we create in userdata

fixes bug 1117594

Change-Id: I0b9201107570334d9846d9613d252da1a91efe8a
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

subject: Each Domain has its own namespace
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-06 15:38:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Each Domain has its own namespace

Previously, a domain could be optionally defined with a private
namespace - meaning that the name uniquness of user and project
entities owned by it would only have to be unique within that
domain.  The fact that there could exist a mixture of domains,
some with and some without such a namespace causes confusion
complexity, both for the api itself as well as poentially for
cloud administrators.  This change therefore defines that a
domain always has its own namespace for user, group and project
names (i.e. they only need to be unique within that domain).

The use of domains remains optional - i.e. it is a supported
configuration to run without any explict domains, in which case
the name uniquness constrains are identical to previous releases
of the Identity Service.

commit_message:
Each Domain has its own namespace

Previously, a domain could be optionally defined with a private
namespace - meaning that the name uniquness of user and project
entities owned by it would only have to be unique within that
domain.  The fact that there could exist a mixture of domains,
some with and some without such a namespace causes confusion
complexity, both for the api itself as well as poentially for
cloud administrators.  This change therefore defines that a
domain always has its own namespace for user, group and project
names (i.e. they only need to be unique within that domain).

The use of domains remains optional - i.e. it is a supported
configuration to run without any explict domains, in which case
the name uniquness constrains are identical to previous releases
of the Identity Service.

blueprint domain-name-spaces

Change-Id: Id2f5ffc275b9ef3ab0937f6874d12d07a86d8b74

commit_message:
Add a cache in Swift middleware

This adds a simple cache mechanism allowing to store cache locally and send
them in batch.

This implements blueprint swift-batched-requests

Change-Id: If3abbf6a62a8e36228b9c454d1a4946addc26af5
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
